definitions.dating_raw: Attested only in the late 16th century.

definitions.definition: Without notice to prepare the mind for the event; sudden ; hasty ; unceremonious .
examples: The party came to an abrupt end when the parents of our host arrived.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the late 16th century.
First attested in the late 16th century.

definitions.definition: Having sudden transitions from one subject or state to another; unconnected ; disjointed.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the late 16th century.
Attested from the early 17th century until the mid 18th century.

definitions.definition: Extremely steep or craggy as if broken up; precipitous .
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the early 17th century.

definitions.definition: Suddenly terminating , as if cut off ; truncate .
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the early 19th century.

main_definition: ( obsolete , rare ) Broken away (from restraint). [Attested only in the late 16th century.]
secondary_definitions: Without notice to prepare the mind for the event; sudden ; hasty ; unceremonious . [First attested in the late 16th century.]
Curt in manner. [First attested in the late 16th century.]
Having sudden transitions from one subject or state to another; unconnected ; disjointed. [First attested in the late 16th century.]
( obsolete ) Broken off. [Attested from the early 17th century until the mid 18th century.]
Extremely steep or craggy as if broken up; precipitous . [First attested in the early 17th century.]
( botany ) Suddenly terminating , as if cut off ; truncate . [First attested in the early 19th century.]
